Protip - Bash Sleep
#bash #protip

Dec 1, 2014 • 0 comments

This is a short post, but something I didn't realize. sleep is a bash utility which will sleep for a given number of seconds and then return. For example, sleep 1000 will sleep for 1000 seconds.

I discovered today sleep will also take in formatted intervals. For example, sleep 1m will sleep for one minute, sleep 2h will sleep for 2 hours, etc...

So if you're tired of multiplying numbers by 60 in your head, you can rest easy now.

Reference: sleep man page
